title: Is it true that one of the collector's editions came with a Steam key?
body: This is what my friend told me, supposedly it was EU only? anyone has an idea about this?

replies.poster: Q r a f T e e
replies.body: In EU, Steam used to have League of Legends listed as a game to download and play. I don't remember if they sold the Collector's Edition off of it, but you could definitely download and launch it through Steam. A Steam key wasn't provided in the Collector's Edition through League of Legends or retail stores though--physical or digital.
ok that's what i figured, thanks for clearing it up
but none of them include steam keys, correct?

> [{quoted}](name=phrostb,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=35BVFXtq,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-05-11T20:37:36.321+0000)
>
> but none of them include steam keys, correct?

As far as I'm aware, there's been no content-awarding partnerships between Steam and Riot Games.
That is correct.  It was (and I think technically is) a way to Launch League of Legends through Steam.  However, there has never been an official partnership between the two.

You can add any game to your steam library and launch it through steam, actually. 

I don't know anything about League being downloadable through Steam in the past though.
You can add LoL as a "Non-Steam Game", but play it from your Library.

That's what I thought told but I know it was sold on Steam for a short period of time in 2009 (?)
he says it was available in walmart? It's all BS i think :[
